In 2011, 6.9 million children under 5 died, mostly from preventable causes such as pneumonia, 
diarrhoea, malaria and neonatal conditions (3, 4) (Figure 1); about 90% of these deaths occurred 
in 42 countries, with half the worldwide deaths occurring in only 6 countries ( 5). Undernutrition 
is associated with more than one third of those deaths ( 2, 6).
